headline: Retail Investors Dump Apple Stock While Nvidia, Tesla See Massive Inflows
summary: Retail investors have been divesting Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares while flocking to Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ:NVDA) and Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) stocks. Retail investors have bought $15 billion of Nvidia stock since July 2025, outpacing all other Magnificent 7 companies combined, according to The Kobeissi Letter, which cited data from J.P. Morgan Equity Strategy & Quantitative Research. Tesla followed with $6 billion in net retail purchases. Retail investors are dumping Apple stock while piling in

headline: Is Tesla Stock a Good Bet? How to Use Magnificent 7 Earnings Volatility to Your Advantage.
summary: Investors can look at options markets to see what traders expect from stocks after earnings reports.  The most aggressive investors can even take bets on what the market thinks about post-earnings volatility.  Having an options straddle position means simultaneously buying a call option, which gives the holder the right to buy shares of a company at a fixed price at a date in the future, and a put option, which gives the holder the right to sell shares at a date in the future.

content.title: Is Tesla Stock a Good Bet? How to Use Magnificent 7 Earnings Volatility to Your Advantage.
content.summary: Investors can look at options markets to see what traders expect from stocks after earnings reports.  The most aggressive investors can even take bets on what the market thinks about post-earnings volatility.  Having an options straddle position means simultaneously buying a call option, which gives the holder the right to buy shares of a company at a fixed price at a date in the future, and a put option, which gives the holder the right to sell shares at a date in the future.

headline: Tech earnings, gold & silver highs, gov't shutdown odds: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed in Monday's pre-market trading as Wall Street looks ahead to a busy week for Big Tech earnings from companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), and Tesla (TSLA).Precious metals commodities gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) are now trading at new record highs.The odds of yet another US government shutdown are rising as the January 30 deadline nears and Senate lawmakers cancelled their vote today due to the massive winter storm.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Tech earnings, gold & silver highs, gov't shutdown odds: 3 Things
content.description:
US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed in Monday's pre-market trading as Wall Street looks ahead to a busy week for Big Tech earnings from companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), and Tesla (TSLA).

Precious metals commodities gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) are now trading at new record highs.

The odds of yet another US government shutdown are rising as the January 30 deadline nears and Senate lawmakers cancelled their vote today due to the massive winter storm.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are mixed in Monday's pre-market trading as Wall Street looks ahead to a busy week for Big Tech earnings from companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL), and Tesla (TSLA).Precious metals commodities gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) are now trading at new record highs.The odds of yet another US government shutdown are rising as the January 30 deadline nears and Senate lawmakers cancelled their vote today due to the massive winter storm.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
